meanings.definition: Sold for less than the usual or expected price.
meanings.sent1: The undersold toy was a great deal for the kids.
meanings.sent2: The store had an undersold promotion on all its products.
meanings.sent3: The undersold cupcakes were a hit at the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: Her talent was undersold by her modesty.
meanings.sent5: The undersold car attracted many buyers due to its low price.

meanings.definition: To sell for less than the actual value or worth.
meanings.sent1: He undersold his old bike to a neighbor.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to undersell their products to increase sales.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly undersold her painting skills to surprise her friends.
meanings.sent4: The negotiator undersold his abilities and caught the opponent off guard.
meanings.sent5: The farmer undersold his crops to help the community during tough times.
